parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From dokimos; to test; by implication, to approve.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
If not, unless, whether at all. From me and the neuter of tis; whether at all.
Failing to pass the test, unapproved, counterfeit. By implication, worthless.
